title: River Teme Walk Route

images.title: Philip Halling / Worcester Bridge
images.caption: Worcester Bridge viewed from the South Quay. There has been a bridge here for many centuries, the present bridge was widened in 1931

images.title: Bob Embleton / The River Teme from The Bransford Bridge
images.caption: The River Teme from The Bransford Bridge. Looking downstream from the 1924 bridge. This is the site of an earlier bridge. If you look carefully just to the right of the swan there is the remains of the central support of the old bridge just beneath the water.

images.title: David Stowell / Knightwick
images.caption: Knightwick. The church and some of the village on the northern side of the River Teme with the road Martley climbing the Ankerdine Hill behind.

description: A walk through the River Teme valley from Worcester to Knightwick. The walk starts on Worcester Bridge in the centre of Worcester and heads south along the Severn Way to Lower Wick where the River Teme meets the River Severn. You then head west along the river to Upper Wick, Bransford, Leigh and Broadwas before finishing at the village of Knightwick in the Malvern Hills. The route is fairly flat with a few moderate climbs along the way. There's lovely views of the surrounding Worcestershire countryside and the river. At Knightwick you can enjoy a climb to Ankerdine Hill and Hay Wood. You can also pick up the Worcestershire Way and head further into the Malvern Hills.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Worcestershire Walks page.

display_address: Bromwich Parade, Bull Ring, St Clements, Worcester, Worcestershire, England, WR2 4RL, United Kingdom
